Retrieve DYN Sales Data from Dynasys

Source: R/data-access_ext.R
pa_td_dyn_get.Rd

Fetches DYN (Dynamic) data from Dynasys using a DuckDB query. This function allows filtering based on various parameters such as version types, forecast types, materials, sales organizations, calendar months, forecast steps, and more.

Usage

pa_td_dyn_get(
  .vtype = NULL,
  .ftype = NULL,
  .material = NULL,
  .salesorg = NULL,
  .scope_matl = TRUE,
  .scope_sorg = TRUE,
  .cm_min = NULL,
  .cm_max = NULL,
  .step_min = NULL,
  .step_max = NULL,
  .lagg_min = NULL,
  .lagg_max = NULL,
  .n = Inf
)

Arguments

.vtype

Character vector. Optional list of version types (e.g., actuals, forecasts). If NULL, all version types are retrieved.

.ftype

Character vector. Optional list of forecast types. If NULL, all forecast types are retrieved.

.material

Character vector. Optional list of materials to filter on. If NULL, no material-based filtering is applied beyond scope constraints.

.salesorg

Character vector. Optional list of sales organizations to filter on. If NULL, no sales organization filtering is applied beyond scope constraints.

.scope_matl

Logical. If TRUE, restricts the query to materials within the Pythia scope. Defaults to TRUE.

.scope_sorg

Logical. If TRUE, restricts the query to sales organizations within the Pythia scope. Defaults to TRUE.

.cm_min

Character or NULL. Minimal calendar month to filter data (e.g., "202301"). If NULL, no lower limit is applied.

.cm_max

Character or NULL. Maximal calendar month to filter data (e.g., "202312"). If NULL, no upper limit is applied.

.step_min

Numeric or NULL. Minimal forecast step ahead to filter data. If NULL, no lower limit is applied.

.step_max

Numeric or NULL. Maximal forecast step ahead to filter data. If NULL, no upper limit is applied.

.lagg_min

Numeric or NULL. Minimal difference between VERSMON and MONTH. If NULL, no lower limit is applied.

.lagg_max

Numeric or NULL. Maximal difference between VERSMON and MONTH. If NULL, no upper limit is applied.

.n

Numeric or Inf. Maximum number of rows to return. Defaults to Inf.

Value

A data.table containing the requested DYN data, with each row representing a combination of material, sales organization, and other attributes based on the query.

Details

This function constructs an SQL query using the provided parameters and executes it via DuckDB. It retrieves the specified data and returns it as a data.table.

The function assumes:

  • A properly configured DuckDB connection.

  • Accessible data files and configurations based on the user's environment.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Fetch all DYN data
dyn_data <- pa_td_dyn_get()

# Fetch data filtered by material and sales organization
dyn_data <- pa_td_dyn_get(
  .material = c("MAT001", "MAT002"),
  .salesorg = c("SORG001", "SORG002")
)

# Fetch data for a specific version type and calendar month range
dyn_data <- pa_td_dyn_get(
  .vtype = "FORECAST",
  .cm_min = "202301",
  .cm_max = "202312"
)
} # }
